item.title: NAS Calderdale Branch AGM 2015
item.description:
NAS Calderdale Branch AGM 2015

The NAS Calderdale Branch will be holding their Annual General Meeting on Sunday 27th of September from 11:00 am until 12:00 pm at the Boiler House in Halifax (here are some directions to the Boiler House, which can be tricky to find). During the meeting there will be Circus Skills activities for children so that those who wish to can attend the meeting. After the meeting there will be activities for children until 2:00 pm. Light refreshments will be served but you may want to bring a packed lunch. For people attending without children the Shears Inn is just next door serving drinks and food.

The event is completely free of charge and you are welcome to attend the meeting whether you are a committee member, a volunteer or just a member of the branch. However as always we are always looking for people to volunteer, no matter what you can offer.

If you are bringing children to participate in the events please let us know by emailing calderdale@nas.org.uk and letting us know how many children will be attending. We need to know this to make sure there is enough supervision for all the children present. Alternatively call on 07798 617448 but please note this mobile is not always answered and you may have to leave a message.

Activities available at the Boiler House are;

  • Climbing
  • Zip Wire
  • Caving
  • Street Surfing
  • Circus Skills

item.title: Care Act Information Session
item.description:
The Care Act is one of the most important pieces of legislation for a long time. It brings some really positive changes for both carers and disabled people and puts an emphasis on ‘wellbeing’. This means that when people are being assessed for support, services have to take their quality of life into consideration. For the first time, ‘care’ is about more than survival, it is about having a life!

The Care Act applies to adults but even if your child is at secondary school now, especially over 14 years it will be useful for you to find out about your rights because that 16th birthday will come quickly. HFT are a national organisation with expertise in supporting families of people with learning disabilities and autism. We don’t often get a chance to benefit from their knowledge and skills in Calderdale, they usually visit big cities, so please come along and arm yourself with information about rights.

To book a place, please contact Lauren Ellis or Amanda Rorrison at CPC on 01422 343090 or email info@cpandc.org.uk
